sentence.Network_en: Don had a hefty roll of flab overhanging his waistband.
sentence.Network_cn: 唐的腰间沉甸甸地坠着一圈赘肉。

sentence.Network_en: That's right ! Flab means fat, especially loose fat that hangs off the body.
sentence.Network_cn: 原来flab就是脂肪的意思, 特别是指身上那些鼓出来的肥肉.

sentence.Network_en: Nevertheless, the study suggests there is flab to be trimmed.
sentence.Network_cn: 不过, 麦肯锡在研究中还是建议裁撤冗余.

entry.tran: 松弛的肌肉，赘肉(尤用于挑剔某人时)
entry.def: If you say that someone has flab, you mean they have loose flesh on their body because they are rather fat, especially when you are being critical of them.

example.ex: Don had a hefty roll of flab overhanging his waistband.
example.tran: 唐的腰间沉甸甸地坠着一圈赘肉。

auth_sentence.content: She looks pretty good...no flab round the thighs yet.
